title: Ghost Election Uprising
outcome: Restored 'ghost' citizens and grassroots organizers stage open elections and public assemblies, challenging Council authority. Civil mobilization and networked town halls escalate to direct demands for a new social contract, forcing reluctant Council engagement. Tensions simmer as popular legitimacy collides with fractured technical governance.

events.description: Restored citizens and activists announce plans for open city assemblies, inviting all to debate Stenograd's future regardless of past BCI history.
Grassroots elections held for 'ghost assembly' representatives; turnout surges in score-blind and formerly restricted districts, drawing widespread attention.
The Directorate circulates a memo warning against participation, labeling the movement a threat to city stability, but arrests backfire and spark further protests.
The ghost assembly issues a manifesto calling for a new social contract and proposes direct negotiations with Council factions. Council reluctantly agrees to televised talks.
